description: Starting index of a string of 6 or more consecutive equal digits in decimal expansion of Pi.
comments: Digits 3,1,4,... are indexed 1,2,3,...a(n) contains 6 nines, 6 nines, 6 eights, 6 fives, 6 sixes, 6 fives, 6 ones, 6 sevens, 6 fives, 6 sevens, 7 threes, 6 fours, 6 twos, 6 sevens, 6 threes, 6 fours, 6 twos, 6 fours, 6 zeros, 7 nines, 6 twos, 6 nines, 6 sevens, 6 zeros, 6 sevens, 6 eights, 6 twos, 6 zeros, 6 ones, 6 nines, 6 eights, 6 nines, 6 eights, 7 threes, 6 ones, 6 fours, 6 fours, 7 sevens, 7 nines, 6 twos, 7 fives, 6 nines, 6 fours, 6 eights, 7 sevens, 7 zeros, 6 sixes, 6 threes, 6 sixes, 7 nines, 6 sevens, 6 threes, 7 ones, 7 eights, ..., . - _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 28 2006
